title: Katie Price involves police after ex Charles Drury ‘stole’ from her
text:
Katie has reportedly turned to police after accusing Charles Drury of ‘stealing’ from her (Picture: Charles Drury/Katie Price/Instagram)

Katie Price has had to involve police after finding out that her toyboy Charles Drury has allegedly ‘hacked her phone and stole from her’.

The former glamour model, 41, had a brief fling with the 22-year-old earlier this year while she was reportedly still with Kris Boyson, 30, but has now claimed Charles was also trying to leak information on her.

Insiders claimed to the MailOnline: ‘He went through her phone and stole from her. Katie’s gone to police as he’s threatening to leak information.

‘She feels betrayed and shocked – she had no choice but to get police involved. They are investigating.’

Katie reportedly dumped Kris over text message after meeting Charles, and is said to be ‘devastated’ about the betrayal.

According to The Sun, Charles had refused to sign a non-disclosure agreement about his time with Katie, but denied stealing from her.

A source claimed: ‘Katie is completely paranoid that Charles has taken things from her throughout their relationship.

Katie is currently busy renovating her ‘mucky mansion’ (Picture: YouTube / Katie Price)

‘She called Charles and threatened to ring the police. She’s accusing him of stealing from her, but he is adamant he’s done nothing of the sort.’

A representative for Charles denied the claims: ‘Charles has not stolen anything from Katie. He has also not had any contact from the police.’

Katie has also recently spoken out on her YouTube channel about how most of the men she has dated have appeared to use her to boost their own profiles.

She told her followers: ‘They’ve become Mr Prices, try be famous, end up getting Instagram posts on the back of me, getting all jobs and being able to earn money from stories and that but always mentioning my name…’

The mother of five is currently in the midst of renovating her Sussex home, with rumours she is planning to transform the property – dubbed the ‘mucky mansion’ – into a wedding venue.
